post.body: I've been watching ZeroNet for some time now and thought I'd give it a try. Hey there!

I know that this is an anonymous network, but I think that many of the goals (?) are the same both of the users of ZeroNet and of a new cryptocurrency-inspired of the a universal dividend. It, however, is not anonymous: one must have a verifiably unique identity that is linked with a real-world identity, though it need not be a person (it could be a company). Also, anyone who is part of the network and who contributes to it will get payed automatically every day they are active. This is different from Bitcoin in that it gives everyone the same reward, so there is the same chance for profit for everyone.

Take a look here: http://en.duniter.org/

comment.body: ZAlex, I have certified you. Have fun! :)
@greatsick the public key is used to search for a user in the Duniter/Sakia client software. You need it to verify an account/identity.
